metadata.dcterms:title: County-level detection dates for beech scale in Canada and the United States
metadata.dcterms:creator: Cale, Jonathan A
Morin, Randall S
metadata.dcterms:description: This dataset contains the years beech scale (Cryptococcus fagisuga; a predisposing agent of beech bark disease) was first detected in counties of Canada and the United states. These data were aggregated from observations made from 1890 to 2015 in order to map the spread of the insect throughout its invaded range in eastern North America. Detection year data are organized by country, province/state, and county for a total of 389 records with references to their original reporting literature.
metadata.dcterms:subject: Beech bark disease
Cryptococcus fagisuga
Neoectria
Range expansion
Invasive insects
Forest health
metadata.dcterms:isReferencedBy: Cale JA, Garrison-Johnston MT, Teale SA, Castello JD. Beech bark disease in North America: Over a century of research revisited. 2017. Forest Ecology and Management., doi, 10.1016/j.foreco.2017.03.031

Cale JA, Garrison-Johnston MT, Teale SA, Castello JD. Beech bark disease in North America: Over a century of research revisited. 2017. Forest Ecology and Management., doi, 10.1016/j.foreco.2017.03.031

Morin RS, Liebhold AM, Tobin PC, Gottschalk KW, Luzader E. Spread of beech bark disease in the eastern United States and its relationship to regional forest composition. 2007. Canadian Journal of Forest Research., doi, 10.1139/X06-281
